title: Fairy Flowers
provenance_text:
Marie Laurencin [1885-1956], Paris, France, until 1950 [1]; Mr. [1881-1966] and Mrs. Roy Arthur Hunt (Rachel McMasters Miller Hunt) [1882-1963], Pittsburgh, PA [2]; their son Alfred Mortimer Hunt [1919-1984], Pittsburgh, PA, until July 30, 1984; his gift to Museum of Art, Carnegie Institute, Pittsburgh, PA, October 1984.

Notes:
[1]. The painting was no. 123 in the "Pittsburgh International Exhibition of Paintings" held at Carnegie Institute, October-December 1950. 
[2]. Purchased from the Carnegie International by Mrs. Roy A. Hunt for $900. Mr. and Mrs. Roy Arthur Hunt are listed as owners of the painting to the 1963 exhibition "Art Since 1900 - Privately Owned in the Pittsburgh Area" (see label removed from the back of the painting in curatorial file.)
[3]. The painting arrived at the museum on July 18, 1984; it was accepted as a gift on July 30, 1984, following approval by the Acquisitions Committee, and accessioned on October 4, 1984.
